alert.note: Alert for Yosemite NP outside of the valley; Yosemite Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 30 at 3:30AM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: .Warm temperatures may melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following areas, Yosemite NP outside of the valley and Yosemite Valley. * WHEN...Through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. This includes Yosemite National Park, as well as Pohono Bridge in Yosemite Valley. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Very warm temperatures will continue and cause rapid snow melt which is expected to contribute to flooding along waterways in Yosemite National Park. This also includes locations in Yosemite Valley, such as the Merced River at Pohono Bridge. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Yosemite NP outside of the valley; Yosemite Valley
